alert.note: Alert for Halifax; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 1:04PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Warren and northwestern Halifax Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 104 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gasburg to near Littleton to 16 miles north of Dortches. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Littleton, Weldon, Medoc Mountain State Park, South Weldon, Airlie, Rosemary, Roanoke Rapids Lake and Lake Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
